title: Upper Case
text:
Example
The upper() method returns the string in upper case:

a = "Hello, World!"
print(a.upper())

Try it Yourself »

title: Lower Case
text:
Example
The lower() method returns the string in lower case:

a = "Hello, World!"
print(a.lower())

Try it Yourself »

title: Remove Whitespace
text: Whitespace is the space before and/or after the actual text, and very often you want to remove this space.

Example
The strip() method removes any whitespace from the beginning or the end:

a = " Hello, World! "
print(a.strip()) # returns "Hello, World!"

Try it Yourself »

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
a = " Hello, World! "
print(a.strip()) # returns "Hello, World!"

title: Replace String
text:
Example
The replace() method replaces a string with another string:

a = "Hello, World!"
print(a.replace("H", "J"))

Try it Yourself »

title: Split String
text: The split() method returns a list where the text between the specified separator becomes the list items.

Example
The split() method splits the string into substrings if it finds instances of the separator:

a = "Hello, World!"
print(a.split(",")) # 
  returns ['Hello', ' World!']

Try it Yourself »
Learn more about Lists in our Python Lists chapter.

title: String Methods
text: Learn more about String Methods with our String Methods Reference
